item.title: 亚马逊的两款新 Echo 扬声器明显胜出— 无论有没有 Alexa+
item.description:
评论：售价 100 美元的 Echo Dot Max outshighs the pricier Echo Studio.

【原文：

Review: The $100 Echo Dot Max outshines the pricier Echo Studio.

】

item.title: 劳动力市场担忧加剧，美国成屋待完成销售停滞不前
item.description: 9 月份，美国现房待售量停滞不前，这表明尽管抵押贷款利率出现了可喜的放宽，但对就业市场的焦虑仍使潜在购房者望而却步。【原文：Pending sales of existing US homes stalled in September, suggesting anxiety about the job market kept potential buyers sidelined despite a welcome easing in mortgage rates.】

item.title: 加拿大央行将利率下调至 2.25%，利率水平 "恰到好处
item.description: 加拿大央行下调了利率，因为它认为美国关税造成的损害仍在持续，但同时表示，只要其预测得以实现，借贷成本大致就会处于合适的位置。【原文：The Bank of Canada cut interest rates as it sees damage from US tariffs persisting, but signaled that borrowing costs are roughly at the right place as long as its forecasts materialize.】

item.title: 期权专业人士看到零售定向结构性产品的商机
item.description: 通过交易所交易产品和结构性产品进行零售交易的最新发展为小型参与者提供了更复杂的策略，同时也为对冲基金和其他大型交易商提供了从市场混乱中获利的机会。【原文：The latest outgrowth of retail trading via exchange-traded and structured products is opening more sophisticated strategies to smaller participants but also offering hedge funds and other large traders opportunities to profit from dislocations in markets.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数先于美联储上涨，英伟达触及历史性的 5 万亿美元大关
item.description: 周三，随着华尔街为包括美联储利率决定和三大科技巨头财报在内的密集议程做好准备，美国股市继续保持以科技为主导的涨势。【原文：US stocks continued their technology-led rally on Wednesday as Wall Street geared up for a jam-packed agenda that includes a Federal Reserve interest-rate decision and earnings from three technology behemoths.】

item.title: 盎格鲁集团预计智利铜矿将于 2027 年恢复满负荷生产
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）预计，其位于智利的旗舰铜矿将在2027年恢复到正常产量水平，而在此之前，矿石质量较低的时期将限制明年的产量。【原文：Anglo American Plc’s expects its flagship copper mine in Chile to return to normal output levels in 2027 after grappling with a period of lower quality ore that’s set to constrain production next year.】

item.title: 甲骨文债券风险因对人工智能消费热潮的担忧而飙升
item.description: 信用交易员正在购买甲骨文公司债务违约保护，摩根士丹利认为，随着这家科技巨头将数十亿资金投入人工智能领域，这一趋势在短期内仍将持续。【原文：Credit traders are buying protection against Oracle Corp. defaulting on its debt, a trend that Morgan Stanley sees continuing in the near term as the tech giant pours billions into artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Character.AI 将禁止 18 岁以下儿童与其聊天机器人交谈
item.description: 人工智能初创公司 Character.AI 将禁止儿童在其平台上与聊天机器人对话，因为立法者的压力越来越大，而且有大量诉讼指控该公司的所谓角色对儿童造成了伤害。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup Character.AI will ban kids from having conversations with chatbots on its platform following growing pressure from lawmakers and a raft of lawsuits alleging the company’s so-called characters are responsible for harms to children.】

item.title: 立陶宛以 "混合攻击 "为由关闭与白俄罗斯的边境
item.description: 立陶宛总理谴责走私者的气球对空中交通造成的干扰是一种混合攻击，因此立陶宛关闭了与白俄罗斯的边境一个月。【原文：Lithuania closed its border with Belarus for a month as the premier denounced disruptions to air traffic caused by smugglers’ balloons as a hybrid attack.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚的数字税收计划有可能扼杀支付革命
item.description: 哥伦比亚政府提议对数字交易征收预扣税，这有可能扼杀中央银行减少现金使用、革新支付系统的计划。【原文：A Colombian government proposal to charge withholding tax on digital transactions risks strangling the central bank’s plan to cut the use of cash and revolutionize the payments system.】

item.title: 葡萄牙警方在腐败调查中锁定毕马威会计师事务所和新银行
item.description: 葡萄牙警方周三对毕马威会计师事务所（KPMG LLP）的里斯本办事处进行了搜查，这是对涉及诺和诺德银行（Novo Banco SA）的腐败指控进行调查的一部分。【原文：Portuguese police on Wednesday carried out searches at the Lisbon offices of KPMG LLP as part of an investigation into corruption allegations involving Novo Banco SA.】

item.title: 特朗普对东盟国家的关税减免力度不大
item.description: 美国总统正在亚洲签署协议，为该地区的出口锁定更高的成本【原文：The US president is signing deals in Asia that lock in higher costs for exports from the region】

item.title: Uber 将与 Lucid 和 Nuro Robotaxis 在旧金山对抗 Waymo
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc. ）准备明年首次在旧金山湾区提供由 Lucid Group 公司和 Nuro 公司开发的无人驾驶汽车，这将使该公司与 Waymo 的机器人出租车服务展开直接竞争。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. is preparing to offer driverless rides on vehicles developed by Lucid Group Inc. and Nuro Inc. in the San Francisco Bay Area for the first time next year, thrusting the company into direct competition with Waymo’s robotaxi service.】

item.title: Harry You SPAC 计划与盒装诊所公司 OnMed 合并
item.description: 空头支票交易老手 Harry You 的最新特殊目的收购公司正寻求与一家经营便携式保健站的企业合并。【原文：Blank-check deal veteran Harry You’s latest special purpose acquisition company is looking to merge with a business that operates portable health-care stations.】

item.title: 乍得寻求 300 亿美元五年发展计划的支持者
item.description: 乍得正在邀请投资者和捐助者前往阿布扎比，因为这个西非国家正在为一项价值 300 亿美元的计划寻求融资，以开发贸易走廊、重要矿产矿山和农业项目。【原文：Chad is inviting investors and donors to Abu Dhabi as the West African nation seeks financing for a $30 billion plan to develop trade corridors, critical-minerals mines and agricultural projects.】

item.title: 沃伦和桑德斯说，401（K）基金中的 PE 对美国人来说 "危险"。
item.description: 民主党参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）和独立参议员伯尼-桑德斯（Bernie Sanders）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统让私募股权和加密货币在普通退休储蓄者的投资组合中占据更大比重的举动可能会导致数百万美国人的财务受损。【原文：President Donald Trump’s move to let private equity and cryptocurrency become bigger pieces of the average retirement saver’s portfolio could lead to financial harm for millions of Americans, Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren and independent Senator Bernie Sanders said.】

item.title: 富裕投资者如何利用期权数学廉价借贷
item.description: 2021 年底，房地产市场过热，美联储的基准利率徘徊在零附近，托尼-杨（Tony Yang）找到了一种非常规的方式来支付他的首付款。【原文：In late 2021, as the housing market overheated and the Federal Reserve’s benchmark interest rate hovered near zero, Tony Yang found an unconventional way to fund his down payment.】

item.title: 瑞士预计美国关税将从明年起打击税收收入
item.description: 瑞士政府预计，从明年起，美国的高关税将影响其增值税收入，因为征税会拖累经济增长。【原文：Switzerland’s government expects high US tariffs to impact its revenue from value-added tax from next year as the levies weigh on growth.】

item.title: 被排除在 Selecta 债务交易之外的对冲基金在美国提起诉讼
item.description: 一群 Selecta 债权人正在起诉这家自动售货机公司及其部分债券持有人（SVP、Invesco、Man Group 和 Diameter），称他们今年早些时候达成的重组协议违反了美国反垄断法。【原文：A group of Selecta creditors is suing the vending machine company and some of its bondholders — SVP, Invesco, Man Group and Diameter — arguing that a restructuring deal they agreed earlier this year violated US anti-trust laws.】

item.title: 西方必须走在稀土的前面
item.description:
关键矿产的进口商已经看到了他们与中国接触所带来的隐患，但建立替代供应链是一项艰巨的任务。【原文：

Importers of the critical minerals have seen the pitfalls of their exposure to China, but building alternative supply chains is a formidable task.

】

item.title: 投资组合激增至 220 亿美元后，加拿大养老金将增加对印度的投资
item.description: 加拿大最大的养老基金将进一步加强在印度的投资，该基金的最高负责人表示，在过去五年中，该基金在印度管理的资产增加了两倍，达到约 220 亿美元。【原文：Canada’s largest pension fund will further boost its investments in India, where it has tripled assets under management over the last five years to about $22 billion, its top executive said.】

item.title: 不良资产基金夺得美国最大购物中心之一的控制权
item.description: 一家不良债务基金正在夺取美国最大购物中心之一的控制权，在此之前，该基金采取了一系列行动，使一些债权人血本无归，甚至使曾被评为 AAA 级的债券持有人蒙受巨大损失。【原文：A distressed-debt fund is seizing control of one of the largest malls in America after a series of moves that wiped out some creditors and even left holders of bonds once rated AAA nursing steep losses.】

item.title: 前 FTX 美国负责人计划为股票和货币引入关键加密货币功能
item.description: FTX 美国公司前总裁布雷特-哈里森（Brett Harrison）又回来了，他计划将加密货币市场波动背后的一股关键力量引入股票和大宗商品交易这个更为稳健的领域：永久期货合约。【原文：The former president of FTX US, Brett Harrison, is back with plans to bring a key force behind crypto market volatility to the more staid world of stocks and commodities trading: perpetual futures contracts.】

item.title: 美联储被认为不会做出特朗普希望的持续降息承诺
item.description: 几乎所有人都预计决策者将在周三降低借贷成本。【原文：Policymakers are almost universally expected to lower borrowing costs on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受特朗普提振，阿根廷瞄准 160 亿美元的美国判决
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）的政府希望在曼哈顿的法庭上继续其最近在政治和经济上取得的一连串胜利，以推翻美国法院对南美国家做出的一项价值 160 亿美元的判决。【原文：The government of Argentine President Javier Milei is hoping its string of recent political and economic victories continues in a Manhattan courtroom as it seeks to overturn a $16 billion US court judgment against the South American nation.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率降至 6.3%，促进购房和再融资
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率降至一年新低，鼓励更多房主进行再融资，并吸引潜在买家进入市场。【原文：US mortgage rates fell to a fresh one-year low, encouraging more homeowners to refinance and drawing prospective buyers into the market.】

item.title: 高昂的可可成本让巧克力制造商为万圣节提心吊胆
item.description: 万圣节将是对巧克力行业的一次考验，因为高昂的可可成本有可能加速消费者转向更便宜、更时尚的糖果，如酸味软糖。【原文：Halloween is shaping up to be a test for the chocolate industry, as high cocoa costs threaten to accelerate a consumer shift toward cheaper and trendier sweets such as sour gummies.】

item.title: 二手车困境加剧，Carvana 的 9000% 反弹面临利润考验
item.description: 从最近发生的事件来看，二手车行业的基础并不稳固。一家大型贷款公司破产了，紧接着一家大型零部件供应商也跟着破产了。贷款拖欠率飙升，汽车价格居高不下，低端消费者也出现了退缩的迹象。【原文：The used-car industry isn’t exactly on firm footing, going by recent events. A major lender went bust just before a big parts supplier followed suit. Loan delinquencies have skyrocketed, car prices remain high and the lower-end consumer is showing signs of buckling.】

item.title: Etsy 任命首席增长官担任首席执行官，引领人工智能时代的到来
item.description: 在线市场 Etsy Inc. 将提升首席增长官 Kruti Patel Goyal 担任首席执行官一职，委托这位公司资深人士驾驭人工智能时代。【原文：Online marketplace Etsy Inc. will elevate Chief Growth Officer Kruti Patel Goyal to the CEO job, entrusting the company veteran with navigating the artificial intelligence era.】

item.title: 投资者准备应对预算案对经济的打击，英镑下跌
item.description: 由于投资者担心即将公布的英国预算可能会增加税收和削减开支，从而加剧经济放缓，英镑因此承压。【原文：The pound is coming under pressure as investors brace for potential tax rises and spending cuts in the upcoming UK budget that may exacerbate the economic slowdown.】
